benchmark_details.name: Prompt Stability Matters: Evaluating and Optimizing Auto-Generated Prompt in General-Purpose Systems
benchmark_details.overview: This paper introduces prompt stability as a core design principle in automated prompt generation systems for general-purpose multi-agent systems, proposing a metric for evaluating stability while contributing practical tools for building more trustworthy systems.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To develop a stability-aware prompt generation system that enhances both prompt quality and system-level performance.

data.source: Empirical studies across general-purpose and domain-specific tasks.

methodology.calculation: Evaluations based on empirical performance across multiple runs.
methodology.interpretation: Higher semantic stability scores correlate with improved task success rates.
methodology.baseline_results: Promptor achieves improved performance over other systems in various tasks.
methodology.validation: Validation through empirical performance metrics and ablation studies.
